Description: Couvent dans le désert, one of three studies for Plate 73 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; a fortified town, including a convent or monastery, in the desert, surrounded by hills Pen and grey ink
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by L P F Garreau. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
